UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
A peasant with a stick.
A peasant armed with a crude club.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. They will make slaves of any fighter they defeat in battle; they will conscript any banker, baker, or miner whose path they cross. From those slaves they will make soldiers, and from those soldiers, massive armies driven by fear of the lash, and inculcated with the discipline prescribed by Vergaxa centuries earlier.

UnitType.Description: Use scouts to explore the world.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. They will make slaves of any fighter they defeat in battle; they will conscript any banker, baker, or miner whose path they cross. From those slaves they will make soldiers, and from those soldiers, massive armies driven by fear of the lash, and inculcated with the discipline prescribed by Vergaxa centuries earlier.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. They will make slaves of any fighter they defeat in battle; they will conscript any banker, baker, or miner whose path they cross. From those slaves they will make soldiers, and from those soldiers, massive armies driven by fear of the lash, and inculcated with the discipline prescribed by Vergaxa centuries earlier.

UnitType.Description: Crossbowmen can fire through units in lines and are a great way to deal with masses of enemy units.

UnitType.Description: Defenders are formidable troops that are able to outlast enemy units and absorb lots of damage.

UnitType.Description: Sentinels are powerful melee units, able to do lots of damage to those that fall within their range.

UnitType.Description: Horsemen are excellent for scouting out unknown areas, and escaping when they uncover dangers in those areas.

These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. UnitType.Description: Axemen are good early skirmishers, quick to train and good in most battles.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. UnitType.Description: Ash Mages have passed the Quendar rituals of the scar stone, and have an affinity for fire because of it.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' From those slaves they will make soldiers, and from those soldiers, massive armies driven by fear of the lash, and inculcated with the discipline prescribed by Vergaxa centuries earlier.

UnitType.Description: Frost Mages deal magical damage at range, use them to decimate enemies that rely on physical defense.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. From those slaves they will make soldiers, and from those soldiers, massive armies driven by fear of the lash, and inculcated with the discipline prescribed by Vergaxa centuries earlier.

UnitType.Description: Dragon Knights are the most expensive and powerful units that can be trained. They combine the best armor, weapons and enchanted items with reliable mounts and advanced training.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. They will make slaves of any fighter they defeat in battle; they will conscript any banker, baker, or miner whose path they cross. From those slaves they will make soldiers, and from those soldiers, massive armies driven by fear of the lash, and inculcated with the discipline prescribed by Vergaxa centuries earlier.

UnitType.Description: The Dragon Squires are outfitted with enchanted weapons and items. They are a powerful tool for any empire, but expensive to train.

UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.
